question.body: Which of the following is not a function of a synergist?

multiple_choice.choice: Helps the agonist work more efficiently
Stabilize the origin of the agonist.
Stabilize the insertion of the agonist.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Helping the agonist work more efficiently is one of the functions of synergist.
Incorrect. A synergist will prevent the movement of a joint that is the origin of the agonist and will stabilize this joint.
Incorrect. A synergist will prevent the movement of a joint that is the origin of the agonist and will stabilize this joint.
Correct. A synergist will stabilize the origin not the insertion.

question.body: Which of the following is not a method of naming muscles?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Muscles are named for their size. One example is the gluteus maximus.
Incorrect. Muscles are named for their shape. One example is the deltoid.
Correct. Muscles are not named after their agonist.
Incorrect. Muscles are named for their location. One example is the brachioradialis.

question.body: The action a muscle generates is determined by what two things?

multiple_choice.choice: The location of the body and the belly of the muscle
The location and orientation of the fascicles
The location of the tendons and fascicles
The location of its origin(s) and insertion(s)

response.feedback: Incorrect. The body and the belly of the muscle are the same and located in the middle of the muscle.
Incorrect. The fascicles run through the entire muscle.
Incorrect. The tendons attach the muscle to the bone and the fascicles are actually part of the muscle.
Correct. The action a muscle generates is determined by its origin(s) and insertion(s)
